intro: Nicotiana linoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tobacco, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals and a distinct tubular shape. Nicotiana linoides contains nicotine and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes or in horticultural research.
